content:
Hello

Take a look at https://connect.mozilla.org/t5/discussions/layout-css-devpixelsperpx/td-p/42594

Or Check Thunderbird are stopped Then Go to your profile https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data and find your prefs.js file and open with your notepad and delete line user_pref("layout.css.devPixelsPerPx", "125"); And save prefs.js and restart Thunderbird.

content: - on windows desktop, click the windows key and the letter 'r' to open a small window - in that, enter %appdata% and press enter key - that should take you to the appdata\roaming folder - click the thunderbird folder and then the profiles folder - this is where profile folder is. if there are more than one, look for the one with prefs.js and latest date - open prefs.js with notepad. locate the entry and replace content with -1.0 and save - restart thunderbird
creator: davidsk

content: did you install thunderbird from the Microsoft store? if so, it places profile elsewhere. It might be in appdata\local. I will also suggest one of my favorite free apps: everything . The name is 'everything' and it is free at https://www.voidtools.com/ download and install and start it. It's very small and is the fastest search tool on the planet. Once started, enter prefs.js and within 2 seconds, it will have found it. I use Everything almost every day when searching for a file. Let me know if you get this resolved.

content:
Informazioni utili da fornire nelle richieste al forum:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)

content:
Jamesrsamec41 said
How may I keep a thread when requesting TB-support? TB-support wants me to stop creating a new thread for dealing with the same issue.

It is best to stay in one thread instead of posting multiple threads on the same subject as it is hard for anybody to helping you to keep track on what has been said already.

In case you forgot, to reply in the thread scroll down to the Post a Reply box, type in your reply, then click on Post Reply button.

As you can see in https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/user/Jamesrsamec41/ you have multiple threads on one subject already.
creator: James

content: Sometimes compacting fails and residue is left on hard drive. I suggest looking at the profile with the OS's file viewer. If you see NSTMP files, they can be deleted. Over time, other problems may have surfaced, causing the POP account folders to appear more than once, such as inbox, inbox-1. If unsure, posting a screenshot of the Mail folder, especially the Mail\<POPaccount> folder.

content: I looked up those warnings and came across this article: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1406629. The solution there seemed to work for me ... the sqlite file must have been scrambled, so deleting-it-and-letting-it-regenerate fixed the issue. Thank you for pointing me to the Error Console.

content:
Hi,

I found other messages in the FORUM and found the problem:

It is the linked MacOS Address book which slows-down the start-up and freezes once in a while. I also saw that in the THUNDERBIRD MacOS Address book, there was an empty contact, duplicated for about 10 times... more and more often.

When linking the address book again, START-UP again takes up to one minute. The memory and CPU used by THUNDERBIRD and the ADDRESS BOOK hog up the entire computer...

Maybe I Shift this discussion to here: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1831673  ?
creator: sndbbbl

content: Thanks. That Mac issue is listed in https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:Testing:Memory_Usage_Problems
creator: wsmwk

content:
if the old PC is still available, this cam be easy: Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content:
Prova a fare queste operazioni di manutenzione:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]
creator: @next

content:
".mab" files are old address book files and can be ignored. Multiple mail accounts does not affect the number of address book files.

Stop Thunderbird. Immediately after startup check Error Console for warnings and errors. (ctrl+shift+J).

It may be necessary to click on an address book to generate an error.
creator: wsmwk

content:
If you've forgotten the account password, you have to reset it with AT&T:

https://identity.att.com/identity-ui/fpwd/lander?appName=m14186

Then, you must create a secure mail key and use that in TB in place of the account password:

https://www.att.com/support/article/dsl-high-speed/KM1010523/

Finally, for the outgoing server, select 'normal password' for the authentication method.
creator: sfhowes
